resources.string: Please choose a username at eyes.daylightingsociety.org and insert it above.
Please register a username online and set it in Settings
WhereAreTheEyes requires access to your location to find nearby cameras. Please grant this permission and restart the app.
Your username is not recognized at eyes.daylightingsociety.org. Is it registered on our website?
You are marking pins too quickly. To protect the integrity of the map we cannot allow you to mark cameras for a while.
Your IP address and physical location do not match. To protect the integrity of the map we cannot allow you to mark pins with a proxy.
Mark a camera at this location?

Where are the Eyes is a tool for detecting and evading surveillance. Together, you and other users build a map of surveillance cameras to protect activists, students, and other at-risk minorities. When you pass a camera press the "Eye" button. This will add it to the map, or verify its existence if we already know about it.

Red marks indicate known cameras. A blue dot shows your location. Stay safe.

All button icons from Open Iconic under the MIT license. The app "eye" icon was created by Amanda Howanice for this project.

Further information can be found at eyes.daylightingsociety.org
